intro: Coelogyne glandulosa var. bournei, commonly known as the Bornean Coelogyne, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, pendant flower spikes that bear clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), and it thrives in high humidity and indirect light. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
